Title.evidence: This was a multicentre, double-blind, parallel, placebo-controlled randomized trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This was a multicentre, double-blind, parallel, placebo-controlled randomized trial of 2 mg prucalopride versus placebo in patients undergoing elective colorectal resection.

Participants.evidence: Patients with inflammatory bowel disease and planned ileostomy formation were excluded, but colostomy formation was allowed.

Objective.evidence: The aim was to determine whether prucalopride improved return of gut function and reduced the incidence of PPOI.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was time to passage of stool and tolerance of diet (GI-2).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were allocated in a 1 : 1 ratio, in blocks of 10. Randomization was computer-generated.

Blinding.evidence: All study personnel, medical staff, and patients were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 148 patients were randomized, 74 per arm.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Demographic data were similar in the two groups.

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was no difference in median time to GI-2 between prucalopride and placebo groups: 3.5 (i.q.r. 2–5) versus 4 (3–5) days respectively ( P = 0.124).

Harms.evidence: The rate of PPOI, complications, and adverse events was similar in the two groups.
